## Module 8: Birds of a feather


```{r,cache=T}

yr <- c(2021,2022,2023)

yw_l <- list()

for(i in yr){
 yw_l[[i]] <- occ_data(scientificName = "Setophaga petechia",
                year=i,
                month="3,6",
                limit=500,
                country="US",
                basisOfRecord = "HUMAN_OBSERVATION",
                stateProvince="Massachusetts")[[2]] %>% 
   select(individualCount,year,month,day,decimalLongitude,decimalLatitude)
}

  
yw <- do.call(rbind, yw_l)
 

```

## Module 8: Birds of a feather


```{r}

mass <- ne_states(country = "United States of America",returnclass = "sf") %>% 
  filter(name=="Massachusetts") 


mass %>% 
  ggplot() +

  geom_point(data=yw,aes(decimalLongitude,decimalLatitude,col=year))
```

## Module 8: Birds of a feather

.pull-left[

### The logistic curve
  
```{r}
yw_arrive <- yw%>%mutate(n=1:n()) %>% 
  group_by(n) %>% 
  mutate(date=as.Date(paste0(year,"-",month,"-",day)),
         j.day=julian(date,origin=as.Date(paste0(unique(year),"-01-01")))
  )%>%
  na.omit() %>% 
  group_by(year,j.day,date)%>%
  summarise(day.tot=sum(individualCount,na.rm=T))%>%
  group_by(year)%>%
  mutate(prop=cumsum(day.tot/sum(day.tot,na.rm = T)))
```
]


.pull-right[

```{r}
yw_arrive %>% 
  ggplot(aes(j.day,prop,col=year)) +
  geom_point()
```
]
